title: Rust Cardano Networking Crate
description: Current implementation of Cardano Node provides core infrastructure only in Haskell, which is hard to integrate for many developers.

f6_assessments.q0: Good proposal to continue keep Rust library up to date. The proposal is missing information on how long this funding will cover this maintenance. Is this just until the next funding round (3 months) or a year?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have the skills to deliver on this. Main issue with the plan is that it doesn't state how long this funding will allow the code base to be kept up to date.
f6_assessments.q2: Whilst update to the code base will be easy to audit, without a clear definition of how long funding will cover, it could conceivably stop at any time and still meet the specification. It would be good to see some numbers users that this updates will help support to measure success.

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano node in rust language and API in rust can help onboarding of Rust devs into Cardano in a much easier manner. There is a discontinues Rust API that can be maintained to keep this feature alive. There is a huge benefit to the dev community and in turn to the Cardno for keeping the Rust API in a maintained state.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers include established devs in Cardano like sebastiengllmt (core developer in cardano), andrewwestberg (cncli a rust tool for stakepool) and  Alessandro Konrad (spacebuds). Therefore it is reliability assured that the project will be implemented in the right earnest.
f6_assessments.q2: The project proposes 5 distinct features in Rust and has set a clear scope. The output of the project will be open source and has can be easily monitored.. The amount of money asked is very reasonable and just.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer wants to simplify the implementation of Cardano node (which is currently only in Haskell possible). The funding is for further developing the existing Rust library. The proposal addresses the challenge, and its implementation could accelerate the adoption of Cardano as it will be easier for new devs to work for our ecosystem. However, the proposers do not provide many details about his solution.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has some experience in stack development. There is a GitHub repository linked to the main proposers. Further references would be helpful to understand the team's ability. 
The team provides a list of aspects that they want to include into the Rust library and I can see the benefit. However, there is not much information about how it will be implemented. No go-to-market strategy, no timelines, no budget breakdown to see if the amount is reasonable. Based on the previous deliverables I expect this team to be able to successfully implement this project, but the given information is just showing an idea instead of a plan. With further details I would give a much higher rating next round.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provides a GitHub repository, so the community is able to assess the progress of the project. However, as there are no metrics, timelines and roadmaps, the community has no context on what aspects will be created until what time. Again, with the more information a higher rating could be given

solution: Continue developing already existing open-source Rust library, to keep it up-to-date with ever-changing upstream of Haskell Cardano Node.
experience: Pavel (Pavlix), the lead developer has years of experience in low-level network stack development, including roles at RedHat.
